blast.title: Rice Blast
blast.summary: Fungal disease likely. Early treatment recommended.
actions: Remove affected leaves and burn or discard them safely.
Apply fungicide (e.g., Tricyclazole) according to label and local advice.
Avoid excessive nitrogen fertilizer; improve drainage.

brownspot.title: Brown Spot
actions: Use crop rotation and resistant varieties.
Apply copper fungicides if recommended locally.

leaf_blast.title: Leaf Blast
leaf_blast.summary: Typical lesions observed on leaves due to Pyricularia oryzae fungus.
actions: Spray Tricyclazole 0.6 g/L water or similar fungicide.
Avoid overwatering and maintain proper field drainage.
Use resistant rice varieties if available.

leaf_scald.title: Leaf Scald
leaf_scald.summary: Scald-like lesions observed, possibly caused by Rhynchosporium oryzae.
actions: Ensure proper nitrogen management.
Avoid dense planting; increase air circulation.
Apply recommended fungicides if infection spreads.

narrow_brown_spot.title: Narrow Brown Spot
narrow_brown_spot.summary: Narrow brown lesions appearing under humid conditions.
actions: Use resistant varieties.
Avoid excessive nitrogen and moisture stress.
Apply Mancozeb or Carbendazim if symptoms increase.

sheath_blight.title: Sheath Blight
sheath_blight.summary: Fungal disease causing lesions on leaf sheaths.
actions: Reduce plant density and avoid high nitrogen.
Apply Validamycin (2 ml/L) or Carbendazim if recommended.
Remove infected plant debris after harvest.

bacterialblight.title: Bacterial Blight
bacterialblight.summary: Caused by Xanthomonas oryzae; water-soaked streaks appear.
actions: Avoid field-to-field water flow from infected areas.
Spray Copper-based bactericides as per advice.
Use resistant rice varieties (e.g., IRBB series).

tungro.title: Tungro Virus Disease
tungro.summary: Viral infection transmitted by green leafhoppers.
actions: Remove infected plants immediately.
Control leafhoppers using recommended insecticides.
Plant resistant varieties and avoid overlapping crops.

default.title: General Advisory
actions: Seek local agricultural extension support for confirmation.
Monitor microclimate and implement cultural controls.
